New Records: The Chicago White Sox tied the modern major league record for losses in a season with 120 losses, matching the 1962 New York Mets.
Key Match Events: Andrew Benintendi delivered the go-ahead hit for the second time in as many games with a 10th-inning single.
Lenyn Sosa put Chicago back on top with a tiebreaking solo drive in the fourth.
Korey Lee gave the White Sox a 2-0 lead with a two-run homer in the second.
Pre-Game Insights: The White Sox were trying to avoid a record-breaking 121st loss for the second straight game.
Post-Match Reflections: Grady Sizemore said the team is not going to let anything rattle them and will focus on the game and what they can do to help the team win.
Ron Washington said they were looking for the ball to get in the air or a base hit, but couldn't get it done.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The White Sox emptied a cooler on Benintendi after he came through with another winning hit.
A sparse crowd was largely quiet until the eighth, when fans started to voice their displeasure with chairman Jerry Reinsdorf.
